submission_info.guidelines: All submissions must be original, previously unpublished, and not under consideration or review by any other publication venue.

summary.event: MLOps25 - Workshop on Machine Learning Operations
summary.description: This workshop encourages discussions on bridging the gap between data science experimentation and the reliable operation of ML components in production. We invite submissions that address the open challenges, latest breakthroughs, and practical use cases in the rapidly evolving field of MLOps.

publication_details.accepted_papers: Will be published in the CEUR Workshop Proceedings (CEUR-WS.org).
publication_details.extended_version: Authors will be invited to submit an extended version for consideration in the 'Special Issue on MLOps Advancements: Improving Development, Management, and Interpretability in AI and Machine Learning' in the journal Future Generation Computer Systems (FGCS), ranked Q1 in the Scimago Journal Rank (SJR).

topics_of_interest: Practices to ensure ML model reproducibility, traceability, and explainability
Continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) practices for ML models
Application of MLOps principles to large language models (LLMOps)
Experience reports on real-world MLOps applications
Challenges in applying MLOps to specific domains (e.g., healthcare and finance)
Collaboration and team dynamics in MLOps
Regulatory and policy aspects of MLOps
Security and data privacy in MLOps

submission_guidelines.formatting_instructions: Submissions must follow the CEURART style required by CEUR Workshop Proceedings. Authors can use the LaTeX, Word (DOCX), or LibreOffice (ODT) templates available. An Overleaf template is also available.
submission_guidelines.style_requirements: 1-column style version with the Libertinus font.
